page.title: 01North West Guildford
page.content: This{predominantly urban area}on the northern and western outskirts of the town of{Guildford}is overlooked by the {Cathedral}to the south. The S.E. is part of the inner town and the N.W. is {rural}while the{Army}has Barracks in the north. The residential buildings are mixed, showing a range of council- owned and private properties. The range of educational establishments also stretches from nursery{schools, through all stages, to a{university. {Industry}is represented by an established vehicle manufacturer and a modern estate manufacturing and assembling electronic equipment and computer hardware.{Farming}is predominantly mixed, with some intensive dairying and cash crops. A self-sufficient agricultural college provides training in farm management and horticulture.
